receivedRecommendations.givenAt: July 3, 2024, Jennifer was senior to Jenn but didn't manage Jenn directly
receivedRecommendations.description: Jennifer has been a fantastic coach. I'm so grateful to tap into her vast experience- she's changed my outlook and perspective both professionally and personally. I value her kind and succinct approach, reflecting back patterns and behaviors, that have led to breakthroughs that have been holding me back for years. From my first session with Jennifer, I knew I hit the jackpot- we instantly gelled and she's a great person to work with!

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: July 16, 2021, Brandon worked with Jennifer but they were at different companies
receivedRecommendations.description:
I believe partnerships are made between people and the companies we work for benefit from those relationships. Over the past year I have had the privilege of getting to know and work with one of the finest Partner Managers. Just as a cat always lands on its feet, Jennifer has the ability to always conjur forward motion. She can breath life into dead opportunities and bring to focus the things that matter. We have been able to accomplish quite a lot over the past year in terms of strategy and groundwork for renewing a global partnership which I have to say is a tremendous chore. She listens and hears what my intent is. Jennifer moves mountains and understands how to get access to the right people in a  timely manner. Jennifer has built a tremendous network and knows how and when to leverage it. I constantly challenge her with my "wish list" and she is able to come through (somehow) on those items. Jennifer is more than willing to go to bat for us with her leadership team. 
I can imagine that a large global partner can be very demanding but I never feel rushed nor do I feel it is too much. If it is not a natural gift she has spent years honing her craft and to manifest this everyday is cause for applause. I am very appreciative of her and look forward to harvesting the fruit from the sowing we have done this year. Lets keep the pressure on and the progress going! All my best and Thank you for your partnership Jennifer!

headline: Tech Ops Executive | Simplifying Complex Infrastructure, Cutting Costs, and Driving Always-On Performance Across Regulated Industries
about:
Senior technology executive with deep expertise in infrastructure, operations, and platform modernization—particularly in regulated, high-stakes environments. Recognized for stabilizing complex systems, eliminating legacy bloat, and driving efficiency through open-source and automation. 
A builder and fixer of infrastructure that works. Whether leading IT transformation post-acquisition or optimizing platforms under intense uptime demands, brings a pragmatic, outcome-driven approach: fewer incidents, leaner systems, more value.

Known for: 
- Stabilizing high-risk environments with minimal disruption and lean resources 
- Retiring legacy systems and simplifying tech stacks without vendor lock-in 
- Improving uptime and deployment speed through automation and observability 
- Driving value in financial services, investment tech, and global platforms

experience.position: VP, Technology Operations - Atria Wealth Solutions
experience.description:
Brought in during a post-acquisition phase to stabilize infrastructure supporting six broker-dealer banks and streamline systems left behind by previous vendors. 

Stabilized core infrastructure across a fragmented stack—dramatically reducing outages and restoring system confidence. 

Led a full system audit and rationalization—retiring hundreds of unnecessary VMs and reducing system count to a manageable, performant baseline. 

Designed and deployed a disaster recovery site in Las Vegas with seamless DNS failover—without reliance on external vendors. 

Supported multiple bank integrations while maintaining uptime, security, and system availability across environments. 

Reengineered CI/CD and release workflows—cutting deployment times in half and eliminating release-related incidents.

experience.position: AVP, Sr. Manager: IT Applications, Production Systems Operations at Eaton Vance
experience.description:
Directed production infrastructure and operations for a high-pressure $360B+ investment platform. 

Oversaw four cross-functional teams (App Support, Middleware, DBAs, Release Mgmt), ensuring 24/7 performance and resiliency. 

Modernized deployment processes—moving from Chef to Octopus Deploy; introduced containerization for reliability and speed. 

Standardized routing using F5 appliances to improve failover and developer consistency. 

Reduced escalations and improved velocity through proactive automation and improved observability.

Seattle, WA | 2012 – 2016 
Supported global telematics platforms for automotive OEMs. 

Managed virtual infrastructure for Java-based services across four continents. 

Built custom monitoring pipelines to surface a $200K+ billing issue previously missed. 

Led uptime-focused infrastructure scaling using F5 GTM/LTM and open-source tools. 

Skills Highlighted: Telematics Infrastructure, XenServer, CentOS, Global Monitoring, Java Environments, F5 GTM/LTM, Splunk & Grafana, Root Cause Analytics

headline: Executive Vice President, Americas at SportsArt
about:
• Extensive hands-on experience in the information technology and telecommunications sectors, which includes network administration, hardware/software installation and configuration, troubleshooting, user technical support, and training. 
• Extensive training with Microsoft and Cisco technologies and continuing education to improve overall knowledge of networking.
• Self-motivated and energetic team player. Ability to work within an autonomous system, or part of a team environment.
• Quick learner with the enthusiasm to learn new and challenging technologies.
• Exceptional communication, interpersonal, technical, networking and leadership skills.
• Dynamic IT professional with superior problem solving skills.

experience.description:
Managed team that administered and maintained the information technology systems of a $500M+/yr e-commerce organization.  Assisted in several projects that are leading towards the company’s Level 1 compliance of PCI.  Configured Tripwire software to track file integrity of critical servers and network devices.  Deployed corporate wireless solution that segregated non-corporate computers from the corporate network using a Windows network policy server.  Configured firewalls to allow “need to know” access to each user by implementing several dynamic access policies based on their job function.  

Projects:  PCI Compliance; Upgrade of production eCommerce network; Datacenter design/configuration/migration; wireless network upgrade; integration of ShoeDazzle IT infrastructure with JustFab infrastructure; Migration of Dermstore IT infrastructure to Target’s IT infrastructure; Decommissioning of Sensa’s IT infrastructure; Implementation of StorSimple/Azure backup solution; Implementation of Nimble POC; HQ relocation to a 140K sq. ft. space; Architecture of IT/security/infrastructure cabling/AV and power requirements for each; migration from Brocade ADX load balancer to F5; Corporate-wide network re-IP; on-premise Lync implementation; Exchange 2013 upgrade (from 2010); Disaster recovery site architecture; Migration from VMware standalone virtualization infrastructure to HyperV clusters; Datacenter HA/failover testing (network/servers/power).

Directs all communications and is the point of contact for the issue of communications instructions and protocol during operations as well as for communications troubleshooting, issue, and preventative maintenance. Expert in planning, installing, integrating, operating and maintaining the Army's voice, data and information systems, services and resources. Trained and transitioned a platoon size of 14 personnel to use a new tactical satellite communication equipment program in voice over internet protocol (VOIP), JNN, AN-50, STT, VTC, HCLOS, LAN and WAN operations. Successfully provided data, voice, and radio communications with 100% availability during all tactical exercises.

Reviewed monthly reports; analyze previous reports for trends; directed vendors on how to correct indications of future problems. Developed, implemented, and maintained IT policies and procedures (e.g. new network user policy, disaster recovery plan, approved software policy, change management policy, asset management policy).  Managed over 20 IT-related vendors, which included over 30 remote support technicians.  Managed all technology assets (implementation, installation, procurement, maintenance, support, etc.).  Managed all technology-related projects.  Served as in-house subject matter expert on all hardware equipment, software, personal mobile devices, and peripherals, along with their respective configurations, which resulted in saving costs by not outsourcing technical work not covered in our support contracts (to include on-site time).  Maintained PCI compliance.

Established service desk for managed and professional services.  Configured and implemented trouble-ticket tracking software; developed call-in procedures and escalation workflows.  Analyzed IT infrastructures of small-/medium-sized and enterprise business and recommended solutions to improved employee efficiency and lower IT expenses.  Designed, implemented, supported and maintained data, voice, and wireless systems for small-/medium-sized and enterprise businesses.  Configured, maintained, and troubleshot Cisco networking devices (firewalls, routers, switches, wireless controllers).  Converted client analog telephony systems to IP telephony and/or digital systems using Cisco, ShoreTel, Panasonic, and Baracuda systems.  Transitioned clients from Windows workgroups to domains.  Enhanced security on Windows domain networks by tightening Active Directory heirarchy and by using GPO.  Documented existing networks and provided documentation for all proposed solutions (e.g. Scope of Work, disaster recovery plans, phone system call flows, CapEx requests).  Experienced in configuring and using network monitoring programs (e.g. ManageEngine, SolarWinds, LevelPlatforms, NetEnrich, Veeam, Cisco).  Provided remote and on-site Level I-III support to customers.

Senior Administrator of Asynchronous Transfer Method-Microwave System network, which provides communications to permanent and tactical military installations in Central Iraq.  Managed a staff of 8 employees.  Troubleshot and maintained common computer hardware and software, WAN/LAN hardware and software, and common ATM network systems.  Responded to, diagnosed, and troubleshot computer and/or network problems through discussions with users and network technicians.  Created, maintained, monitored, and deleted network accounts in Active Directory used on non-secured and secured networks.  Configured Cisco routers and switches used in tactical networks deployed to hostile war zones.  Performed effective troubleshooting by isolating faults on computers, networking hardware, telephone equipment, and radio links via multi-meters, the patch panel, signal flow charts, technical manuals and schematics, which brought back to 100% reliability for all communications links with minimal down-time.

headline: Client Chief Process and Digital Transformation Officer. Senior Consultant. Improve client quality, measurements, service, efficiency & governance through coaching, process improvement & advanced technology planning.
about:
George Dunn, President & CEO CRE8 Independent Consultants, helps organizations improve quality, governance, service, measurements. and efficiency through coaching,  operational/process improvement, advanced technology planning, and update of IG programs. George assists clients as on-call Chief Process Officer #CPO, Chief Digital Transformation Officer #CDO, and Senior Independent Consultant.

Operational And Process Improvement
Focuses on aligning, optimizing, and improving how processes, people and systems work together to achieve operational goals. Digital transformation focuses on enhancing the effectiveness and ROI of new technologies and modernizing existing platforms; through proper planning  design and implementation. Information  Governance focuses on updating policies, procedures, and schedules to better meet regulatory, legal, operational, and best practice requirements. 

Advanced Technology Planning
Includes Digital Transformation, Electronic Content Management (ECM), Digital Workflow, Electronic Forms, Electronic Signature, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Artificial Intellegence (AI), Recognition, Machine Learning, and others. 

Deliverables
George develops process and technology - enterprise, department, and workgroup - frameworks, measurements (KPIs), improvement plans, and implementation programs. He also develops process/workflow maps, use case studies, software requirements, return on investment analysis, requests for proposals, ROI assessment, change action plans, and implementation project management plans. Mr. Dunn has over twenty-five years of experience in the above areas, has worked across numerous industries, and has assisted organizations from 25 to 250,000 employees. 

Background
Gerge has served in executive, management, and staff roles for CRE8,, GTE, Wang Labs, ASA, and KPMG. He is certified in Lean/Six Sigma, Business Process Management, Re-engineering, BPM, ECM, Workflow, Management Consulting, Technology Planning,  EDP Audit, and CPA (former). CRE8 staff are accredited in CRM, Agile, Scrum, and PMP.  

George has served as an adviser to the Worldwide Digital Workflow Standards Board for AIIM and is a regular speaker at worldwide and regional events. He is a regular panelist, speaker, blogger, and author at CRE8, BWG, AIIM, ARMA, DSF, AMLAW, GLC, and other industry forums/discussions regarding AI, RPA, ML, Workflow, ECM, etc.

experience.description:
Mr. George Dunn is responsible for the performance of consulting; development and execution of business and sales/marketing plans; recruitment and management of consultants and teams; and assurance that projects meet client and scope of work requirements.  He develops and manages relationships with client board members and C-suite executives; industry thought leaders, subject matter experts, and industry associations.  Previous to CRE8, he has served in executive, management, and staff roles for organizations such as GTE Corporation, Wang Labs, ASA International, and KPMG.

Mr. Dunn’s work includes on call client Chief Process Improvement and Digital Transformation Officer.   George sets strategy,  manages teams to deliver processes improvement initiatives for organizations with 25 to 250,000 employees, develops enterprise technology plans (including cost justification); software design to support 25 to over 50,000 users; measurements (KPIs), and vendor selection. George manages the development and delivery of information governance/records management plans including maturity assessment, policies, procedures, disclosure, and schedules. He has assisted hundreds of organizations including Fortune 500, AmLaw, Government. Middle-market, and instructed thousands of individuals.

Worldwide George is recognized as an expert, consultant, speaker, instructor, and author on business process innovation (TQM, BPM, Re-engineering, LEAN, Six Sigma); digital transformation, workflow mapping and redesign; advanced technology planning (capture, electronic content management RPA, ECM, AI, machine learning, digital e-signature, workflow, electronic records management); and legacy system replacement.  He has written/spoke for BWG, DotCom Magazine, Document Strategy Forum, Corporate Counsel, Law Technology News, AIIM, and ARMA.  George has served as an advisor to the Worldwide Workflow Standards Board for AIIM and as Board member and the Director of Education for numerous AIIM Chapters.

experience.description: Worldwide AIIM Speaker. Past AIIM Director of Education / Programs (Electronic Content Management ECM, Workflow, Electronic Content Management ERM) and Board Member. Former Advisor to ECM Worldwide Workflow Standards.  Former Pacific Northwest AIIM Chapter Board Member.
Previous to CRE8, he has served in executive, management, and staff roles for organizations such as GTE Corporation, Wang Labs, ASA International, and KPMG.

George is a real pro and was wonderful to work with.  He has a wealth of knowledge in multiple business sectors, and I recommend him highly.

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: February 13, 2020, Susan was George’s client
receivedRecommendations.description:

During this time, George provided consultant services that encompassed:

All above efforts enabled my EDM business group to champion our EDM solution and become the enterprise standard. As an enterprise standard, user base increased from 400 to 15,000. George’s services were invaluable and were a major contribution to EDM success within the bank.

projects.title: CRE8 Six Sigma, LEAN, Agile, Cybersecurity, Data Analytics. and Project Management On-line Training, Certification, and Credits
projects.description:
CRE8 is proud to offer Agile, Project Management, Data Security,  Cybersecurity, LEAN and Six Sigma learning courses developed by business school professors, industry professionals, and subject matter experts. This course platform was founded in 1998 by Harvard and MIT educators and continues to innovate in the rapidly changing landscape of online education.

Courses are available 24 hours a day from any device with an internet connection, video/sound ability, and combine interactive exercises, mini-cases, video, and focused reading to ensure these the courses are not only engaging, but that attendees really learn.

projects.title: Chief Digital Transformation Officer CDO
projects.description:
George Dunn President of CRE8 Independent Consultants has extensive experience assisting organizations as a fractional (on call) Chief Digital Transformation Officer.

In this role,  George has helped lead company's digital transformation strategy, which involves using advanced technologies to convert a traditional business process into advanced digital processes. This  effort drives innovation and growth by ensuring that digital strategies align with future business objectives, including efficiency, quality, governance, cost, risk, and customer service.  Advanced technologies include AI, RPA, Machine Learning, Digital Workflow, ECM, etc.

This work includes enterprise studies,  roadmaps, cost/benefit analysis, process/workflow mapping, application design, vendor selection, project management, and measurement.

publications.title: What Are The Signs Your Organization Needs Process Improvement
publications.description: This white paper discusses the following. What are the signs that your organization needs process improvement? What type of process improvement methodologies exist?  Where can process improvement be deployed in your organization? How should your organization proceed? A process improvement checklist. How can CRE8 independent consultants be of help?  An invitation from the author, George Dunn, President CRE8 independent consultants.

publications.title: Does Your Law Firm Need A Chief Process Officer?
publications.description:
This white paper discusses the following questions. 1) How do you know if your law firm will benefit from a Chief Process Officer (CPO)?  2) What are the responsibilities of a Chief Process Officer?  3) Why can't the Partners And other Chiefs handle this work? 4) What happens if there is no CPO in place?

This paper is written by George Dunn, President CRE8 Independent Consultants. George has functioned as a full-time and fractional CPO and innovator for organizations across all industries.  He has assisted law firms, legal departments. courts. and is a world-recognized consultant, speaker, and author.  He can be reached at consulting@cre8inc.com or 206-556-5956.

headline: Manufacturing & Aftermarket Growth Leader | Industrial | Aero | Commercial and Defense | OpEx | CEO | COO | GM | Private Equity
about:
20+ Years of proven commercial and military turn around and expansion success, EBITDA growth, OpEx implementation, and team building, that has matured, stabilized, and successfully exited manufacturing and aftermarket businesses.  Both heavy and precision machining and fabrication experience in Aerospace, Space, Defense and Nuclear markets. Sustainable turn-arounds in multiple manufacturing, assembly and aftermarket business enterprises. Excellent understanding and application of Lean Manufacturing (TPS and TOC) to maximize return on capital.  ITAR, ISO, AS 9100, NQA-1, FAR and DFAR experience

Led and managed Public, Private and PE Manufacturing, CNC, MRO, distribution, and B2B enterprises.  Strong Aero and Defense domain business development relationships.

Extreme focus on Balance Sheet strength and Income Statement growth.  Always balancing the business's financial capacities and capabilities, while focusing on increasing top line and improving gross margin.   Business Development focus and intense Execution skills.

Excellent business and industry relationships in multiple markets, with a deep domain expertise in commercial and defense aviation and aerospace.  Strong business and corporate development skills, always seeking out revenue opportunities, while maximizing the capacity and capabilities of the business and team. 

Demonstrated and proven strategic planning expertise that provides the framework for an enterprise's  growth plan, which will include actionable and tangible management objectives and the corresponding leadership accountability.
 
Accelerated revenue and quickly increased EBITDA through operational performance in complex business situations to deliver high value.  Strong business development and sales skills.  International and multi-site business management and ownership experience.  Have managed and led all facets of business from business development, operations, finance and banking relationships.  

Operational leadership in complex business environments, including international multi-site management.  Have reported to BoD's, PE management teams and private ownership.

Have lead turn-around efforts at both private equity owned and Fortune 500 companies, grown market share, increased revenues and accelerated profits and shareholder value in very challenging environments.  Excellent understanding of aerospace manufacturing and aftermarket services business processes and possess the leadership skills to maximize the potential of teams and the overall business. Lean and Six Sigma trained at Goodrich and Honeywell Aerospace.

experience.description: P&L Responsibility for a $140m private equity (Bain Capital) owned, heavy fabrication and machining operation located in Ogden, Utah and Pocatello, Idaho.  Increased EBITDA by 60% YoY, doubled sales backlog within 15 months.  Business also includes a 3PL Services business unit.  Primary industries include Nuclear, Aerospace, Defense and Mining. We are "anti-consultants," unlike traditional consultancies we act as honest brokers and put skin in the game by risking a significant portion of our remuneration on successful outcomes.  Most of our 27-member global team has held C-Suite positions in Fortune 100 companies, all served as “agents of change” and none bring a career based on consulting; in short, we walk the talk.

CTD connects the dots to enable large enterprises to enter new business opportunities, foster cultural change and accelerate innovation.  We specialize in all aspects of the concept, build and launch of new products and/or services for the client business.

headline: Senior Director, Enterprise Events.  Ex-Amazon
about:
CAREER SUMMARY I am a strategic and relationship-focused event marketing executive with a proven record of designing and executing highly effective and scalable global field event programs. I’m a respected team leader who is trusted by others and achieve the highest levels of engagement and loyalty by leading with authenticity, accessibility, and by example.

My key strengths:
•	Developing and managing global field and partner event programs designed to engage and  deepen relationship with customers  and prospects.
•	Managing cross-functional teams and engaging global stakeholders in designing and integrating all elements of field marketing  campaigns within the context of live events to achieve Sales objectives and revenue goals. Demonstrated ability to work effectively at the strategic, creative and executional levels.
•	Creating scalable, impactful, and cost-effective event portfolios that meet the needs of diverse  sales channels and organizations, across multiple industries and geographies.
•	Building highly-engaged teams, cultivating an empowered and positive work environment, and  minimizing employee turnover by consistently rewarding top performance and mentoring under-performers to achieve  grow in their careers.


Key Strengths:

Field, Local and Channel Marketing / Event Design and Management / Client Experience 
Sponsorship Marketing / Financial Services and Agency Experience / Culinary Arts

Personal stuff:  I was born in the Philippines, spent my early childhood in the US on both the East and West Coasts, my teenage years in Munich, Germany, and my young adult years in Tokyo.  Because of this I have a deep appreciation for cultural and social diversity, world travel, and regional cuisine.

I currently live in Seattle, locating here for my job at Amazon.  I previously lived in the Bay Area for 23 years and am an avid swimmer, hiker, home chef, and outdoor enthusiast.  If I am not in the pool or outside exploring, you’ll find me researching new recipes, catching up on the New York Times, or spending time with my cats Lulu and Ellie.

experience.position: Worldwide Head of AWS Event Content, Field and Partner Event Programs
experience.description:
I lead a 36-person event marketing organization that strategizes, plans and executes large-scale AWS global events, as well as delivers a wide range of event enablement assets for our 1P event portfolio, e.g. content strategy and execution for re:Invent, Global Summits, re:Inforce and field and partner event programs.  My organization builds scalable and repeatable global event programs for the field to execute.  My team also plans and executes the AWS AMER Summit program as well as manages our speaker bar raising program and the tools and platforms that power our speaker enablement efforts. My responsibilities also include direct ownership and management of the AWS Global Summit program, our single largest event marketing investment at scale.

Nominated by executive leadership to act in the capacity of an Amazon Bar Raiser in our Hire and Develop  the Best program, leading the interview and debrief process for ~ 100 candidates  per year across Amazon. The role of the Bar Raiser is to be a steward of Amazon’s 14 Leadership Principles and to maintain our high hiring bar. Bar Raisers have the final say in all hiring decisions at Amazon.

Initially hired by AWS to develop and manage a global event program to engage and inspire members of the AWS Partner Network (APN).  Created the Global Partner Summit, an event program that reaches over 10,000 partners across 20 global events.  My role expanded to include similar global event program design and management for the field marketing organization, resulting in the expansion of global event programs targeting AWS developers, start-ups and enterprise organizations.

Hired by New Relic to create and manage a centralized corporate events department. Responsible for managing a high-performance team of seasoned event professionals in the design and delivery of all corporate events:  proprietary, international user conferences, internal events, and our global tradeshow portfolio.

- Hand's on event producer with the ability to think and work strategically, programmatically, and executionally.
- Experienced team leader with a passion for driving high engagement, mentorship and individual career growth.
- Responsible for evolving and reformatting FutureStack from a local, single-city event, to a global, multi-track series of user conferences. 
- Executive producer of FutureStack '15 - achieved a 35% increase in paid registrations, a 60% increase in sponsorship revenue, and came in at 10% under-budget.
- Recipient of MVP award for FutureStack '15

Event Design and Management:

Respected within the Events department for previous management-level experience within strategic event marketing agencies. That, coupled with a keen understanding of Schwab’s overall business, provides the organization with insight that informs event design and delivery. Responsible for managing nine regional event managers who support Schwab's Advisor Services and Investor Services business units.  

•	Received Key Contributor award for in-sourcing event management function from 3rd party vendor, and restructured team to integrate Schwab’s two largest business units – retail and institutional.   
•	Effective management of resources continually allows for 12% annual growth of event volume, with flat headcount.  2013’s event portfolio of 812 regional events rated “top box” on average for attendee satisfaction, with overall budget under spent by 2%.
•	Recognized by CEO for achieving 95th-percentile Gallup Employee Engagement Scores (2011 – 2013), a key management indicator for high-performing team leaders.
•	Expanded SMMP program to minimize risk, decrease expenses, and provide greater visibility into overall event planning and management process.

Client Experience:

Responsible for understanding Baby Boomer mindset and translating their needs into products and services that increased client satisfaction and drove business for Schwab.

•	Drove strategic direction and on-going management of Real Life Retirement Services (RLRS), a web-based and live experience providing guidance for investors preparing for retirement.
•	Increased acquisition and retention rates among segment by 20% by creating and managing channel momentum plans, ensuring that mar-com, PR, retail branch network and call centers efficiently leveraged RLRS as a key business driver.
•	Successful management of RLRS website (content and UX) increased overall client and prospect engagement metrics by 25%.
•	Received Standing Ovation award for design and delivery of Retirement Seminars for field sales channels.

Field and Local Marketing

Proven success in enabling Schwab’s sales force to quickly evolve from a transaction to a relationship-based sales model.  Responsible for developing regional and first-ever relationship marketing campaigns that effectively and efficiently enabled the sales channel to form client-centric relationships.  

•	Primary field marketing strategist for regional branch executives, branch managers and financial consultants regarding local marketing, client relationship management, brand management and compliance.  
•	Managed strategy, design and execution of all events and sponsorships to ensure alignment with business objectives.
•	Multi-time recipient of Key Contributor award for on-going success in engaging branches to embrace new relationship model.

President of the Board of Directors (2005 - 2008)

As an unpaid volunteer:  

Responsible for overall strategic direction of agency, management of executive director and 16-member board of directors, with particular focus on creating and enhancing relationships with the Department of Public Health, the CDC, federal regulatory agencies, major donors, and corporate sponsors. Board leadership was an excellent opportunity to further strengthen leadership and managerial skills.

Vice President of the Board of Directors (2004 - 2005)
Provided direction, fund development expertise, and board development to San Francisco's premier HIV prevention agency.

Managed PGI/TBA’s Sponsorship Marketing practice, leading pre- and post-sale design of sponsorship and exhibitor programs for global user conferences – PeopleSoft, Brocade, StorageTek, Synygy, Cognos and CFA Institute.
•	Successful management of PeopleSoft Connect resulted in sponsorship / exhibitor revenues increasing 100% from 2003 to 2004.

experience.description:
Managed account team that initiated, developed and executed partnerships and sponsorships on behalf of clients.  Successfully developed partnership marketing practice as a core competency of CMG.
•	Managed London-based sponsorship sales team for Citrix Systems, enabling CMG to create global relationships that benefitted Citrix and other clients, e.g. Intel.

headline: Product Manager
about:
Since 2022 I have been working with generative AI and collaborating with developers to build AI products. I am a product manager and 3x founder.

Projects I've helped build recently are Spellforge.ai for evaluating LLM accuracy and quality, ScamDetect, an AI scam call detector, and resuumi for optimizing résumés (www.resuumi.com).

I have over 8 years of experience in product management across various industries, including e-commerce, food tech, and social networking.

Currently, I work at Amazon building products for Amazon Private Brands.

experience.description: I am working as a Product Manager contractor for Lorien on a year long contract with Amazon as part of the Consumables Private Brands team. As a PM for physical products, I coordinate production, suppliers, compliance, and reporting on my cross functional team.

Product marketing, content strategy and creation, and project management for clients including Microsoft, Supermicro, and Infor. Subject matter includes edge AI, generative AI, and financial services.

Market research, data analysis, roadmapping, and product strategy on behalf of clients and for my own projects. 

Launched two AI MVP apps and acquired active users on both:

-Resuumi (www.resuumi.com) helps job seekers optimize their resume for every application using AI.

-Spellforge (www.spellforge.ai) utilizes AI to simulate synthetic users in order to evaluate performance of AI chatbots and LLM-based apps. I owned customer research, problem/solution validation, roadmap creation, and product testing. Launched an MVP that garnered 100+ stars on GitHub.

-Various retainer projects for third party clients.

Paused new client onboarding and shut down side projects to focus full-time on my work at Spur Reply.

Connexpert was an expert network that provided a two sided marketplace for pairing subject matter experts with people looking to interview them for primary research.

I was hired to run product and launch the software. My work involved market research, roadmap strategy, and oversight of our MVP build & GTM.

OLEO is an ecommerce company that creates dietary supplements for fitness enthusiasts.

I oversaw our digital and physical products, co-founded the company, and later became CEO, helping grow the company to nearly 20 employees and $1m in annual revenue.
Joined OLEO as the third co-founder to establish our product strategy, set up a GTM and marketing plan, and build a data-based business.
Down to Hang was an iOS app that facilitated better human connections through fast, seamless short-term event planning. I owned our product management, marketing, and GTM strategy.
Owned P&L for three major books vendors and managed product marketing, campaign design, and data analysis for all things relating to that business.
Worked alongside engineers to scope projects, plan aircraft changes, and estimate costs of those improvements.

headline: Chief Executive Officer at ARES Tool

experience.description: Monitor inventory levels / replenishment and PO Management. Communicate with 150+ factories. Play instrumental role on major proposals / presentations to customers, using detailed analysis of price, selection, quality, and service to determine approach. Routinely analyze new items being added to pinpoint which items are best accepted by customers. Keep tight reigns on inventory to purge dead / unproductive items and maintain rapid inventory turns, allowing for better options with future financing. Concurrently oversee Quality Control and manage vendor communications dealing with pricing, ship dates, and new item product development.

Originally developed a vital and profitable relationship with the company through servicing them in the prior position and nurturing the account up to the multi-million dollar level; reflected a caring, above and beyond the call of duty.  attitude when the company ran short on inventory, and arranged a suitable replacement and other "deals" to satisfy their buyer. This in turn led to a long-lasting, profitable relationship and recruitment efforts, on their part, that were spurned until offered this unique role with room for advancement.

experience.position: Purchasing Manager / Product Development / Inventory Control
experience.description:
Leading distributor of professional and promotional hand tools in North America producing under the popular names of Performance Tool, Performance Tech, and Mechanics Products. Distributing over 4,000 items to more than 1,000 customers with product lines including professional hand tools, tool sets, specialty tools, jacks, equipment, creepers, air tools, counter top displays and more.
Promoted through the ranks from Purchasing Coordinator to Purchasing Manager, unofficially assuming various additional leadership roles and projects, due to size and scope of the company. Following initial role as Staff Accountant during college, networked into a Purchasing Coordinator role after proving instrumental in working on budgets, assisting with landing key inventory, and streamlining processes.  Oversaw production in the warehouse as a managerial process; allocated labor and schedule to accommodate needs. Orchestrated a broad range of functions across the board as needed to ensure top sales performance and bottom-line profits. Managed the continual control / flow of inventory and all related functions for some of the most difficult to manage items. 
Developed and nurtured key global sourcing relationships in both Asia and India, relentlessly negotiating price, terms, customs, and broker compliance issues. headline: Owner/Principal at DN Holdings, Inc
about:
I have been deeply and passionately involved as an entrepreneur in the finance sector and various businesses for over 25 years. I have worked primarily in the securities brokerage/capital markets, investment advisory, and private investing worlds, but have ventured out into other areas and industries over time.  In addition to my extensive background in finance and business, I have been involved with several technology start-ups.   Having created or co-created and managed multiple businesses for most of my career in my areas of interest and/or expertise, I tend to focus on high growth opportunities. 

Additionally, I have spent considerable time in the investment banking and private equity space throughout my career working with a variety of companies and in various capacities.  In addition to being involved in the capital formation process, I/we have served as a strategic adviser to companies on mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, restructuring, and other finance related initiatives. 

I am currently overseeing the financial and strategic direction of several smaller companies in the Pacific Northwest, one of which is a brand new software development company working on technological solutions for the Fintech space.

experience.description: Investment Holding Company for private equity investments, research, and consulting services. This entity currently overseas the financial, operational, and strategic aspects of various privately held companies in the restaurant industry. Additionally this company manages a small family office and deals with investments in both the public and private equity and debt markets.
Coming soon.........creating revolutionary technologies for the finance industry~! On Hold for now~!

Tabletop Furnace Co. was founded on the principles of product innovation, exemplary service, and dedication to our customers. After reviewing the existing marketplace for portable, high powered firing kilns, we felt strongly that the marketplace was lacking the unique combination of quality and low cost, and we have built our company to fill this void.

Tabletop produces high-powered, highly efficient kilns designed for metal clay, jewelry, and ceramics artists. We strive to incorporate the latest in technological innovation and functionality in every one of our products, while providing top-level support and resources for our customers.

I am one of the founding partners and am co-responsible for the overall strategic direction and growth of the company. I am further charged with all financial aspects for the company.

- Raising/Structuring equity and debt capital for public and private companies in a variety of industries through our affiliated network of broker dealers, private equity, consulting, and investment banking firms.
- Adviser to companies on mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, and other strategic projects.
- Conduct research and due diligence on companies across a wide spectrum of industries.
- Engaged in the buying and selling of companies or divisions of companies to entities or private parties.
- Specialize in deal size ranging from $ 500k to $ 12 million.
- Have analyzed, determined valuations, and/or have been engaged by/worked with dozens of companies for over 15 years.
- Integrally involved in the private equity side of the business that provides advisory services to companies with varying goals and objectives.

Co-directed all operational functions and the strategic direction/growth of the broker dealer, including budgeting and financial forecasting as well as creating, developing and implementing policies and procedures. Grew the company revenues from inception to almost $ 10 million in 3 years.

Successfully maneuvered through the rigorous NASD/FINRA setup and approval process for new broker dealers in 2006.

In addition to the brokerage operations, I also oversaw many aspects of the company's investment banking operations- financial modeling, and deal valuation/analysis. Involved in numerous transactions/deals consisting of capital raising/finance structuring, mergers/acquisitions, and/or strategic advisory services.  Considerable involvement/dealings with hedge funds, private equity groups, M & A firms, and venture capital groups in a variety of capacities for over 15 years.
Highly involved and key contributor to the achievement of Key Operational Benchmarks of the company:

As the CEO of NWT Financial Group, LLC, (a FINRA/SIPC registered broker dealer), I also served as the Head of Investment Banking for the firm.

Successfully transitioned all brokerage business and operations to US Trading Corp. from previous broker dealer, All-Tech Investment Group in 2001.
Became the largest producing branch in the US Trading network of branches through implementation of various growth and expansion strategies.
Established relationships with key industry executives.

Oversaw branch operations of the broker dealer; quickly expanding to 4 offices in 4 different States.
CFO of the branches and the holding company operations.
Grew revenue from $ 0 in 1997 to over $ 6 million annualized in 1999.
Became the largest (revenues) and most profitable branch (Bellevue Branch) of all All-Tech branches (26 in total).
Oversaw staff of near 50; consisting of both operations personnel and proprietary traders.

headline: Founder & Digital Solutions Lead at DesignStack Studio | UI/UX Design | Frontend & Backend Development
about:
Matthias is a systems thinker with a bias for action, someone who thrives in chaos, quickly finds clarity, and builds scalable solutions that work.

Over the years, he’s led projects across product, engineering, and operations. Whether it’s launching a startup, untangling tech debt, or building workflows that actually flow, Matthias specializes in getting high-stakes things unstuck.

He doesn’t just fix what’s broken, he designs systems that don’t break in the first place, by surrounding himself with professionals who are more experienced and/or smarter than he is.

Today, he runs DesignStack Studio, where they help companies build smart, modern digital products with clean code, sharp design, and clear communication at every layer.

If you’re scaling fast, chasing an idea, or cleaning up your backlog and need clarity, execution, and experienced leadership, you’re in the right place.
topSkills: IT Project Management • Leadership • Software Development • Product Management • Management

experience.description:
DesignStack Studio is a full-service digital agency specializing in UI/UX design, conversion optimization, front & backend development, front & backend architecture, covering web & mobile development. 

We help startups and growing businesses turn ideas into polished, scalable digital products, from concept and design to launch and beyond. Our team blends creative vision with technical expertise to deliver seamless, user-centered solutions across web and mobile platforms.

• Grew business from a founder-only shop to 37 employees in 2 years. Led multiple scrum teams of engineers, UX designers and product managers.
• Delivered over 30 software development and user experience design projects for a range of web3 / blockchain clients operating in multiple industries, including fintech, gaming, and social platforms. Project durations ranged from a few weeks to 7 months.
• Directly led product strategy and management, engineering team management and on-time delivery. Was consistently rehired by multiple clients, including Kolahon Labs (4 projects); Increment (5 projects); Deep Work Studio (3 projects); and Deep Skills (3 projects).

• Led the turnaround of the engineering department, recovering the client’s flagship project from near-failure to the successful launch of a transformative ed-tech platform in 5 months.
• Drove the complete restructuring of the engineering department; replaced 8 underperforming resources (engineering, UX, business analyst) within one week through focused interviewing and hiring.
• Met daily with the CEO to align organizational goals to engineering efforts, ensuring high-quality, and timely delivery of all milestones.
• Implemented standard procedures for feature requests, ticketing, and bugs, reducing time-to-correct defects from weeks to 1-3 days

(Acquired by Twilio for $859 million)

• Assisted in the refactoring our main SaaS platform codebase from ReactNative to React
• Introduced Swagger to all dev teams and updated current API docs to use swagger for easy visualization and collaboration
• Developed and deployed many features at the direct request from our CEO, also worked closely with upper management to launch a new dev team that rotated engineers based on workload, that could focus on small, necessary features that would be easy to build and test within a sprint for deployment
• Launched the self service signup which was a main selling point in the acquisition of Zipwhip by Twilio.

• During Q3 2018, developed a working prototype of a mobile app in the wearables/health space for T-Mobile’s Digital Strategy team, demonstrating the top 4 user stories
• Presented the app prototype to multiple executives; helped to work toward partnerships with a (confidential) university and (confidential) medical research company
• Prototype Stack: React, Redux, JavaScript, CSS, MaterialUI, Bootstrap, Firebase (Database, Auth), Heroku
• Managed agile software development team using SCRUM methodologies

• Built v1.0 of a health and fitness tool via web app
• Working with: React, Redux, FirebaseDB, FirebaseAuth, JavaScript, CSS, Reactstrap (React Bootstrap Library)
• Collaborated with the co-founders to determine requirements and user stories

• Led product development for a line of 14 new products
• Managed Amazon, online and retail sales growth delivering +150% YoY in 2017, +45% YoY in 2018
• Redesigned production operations around Lean principles, increasing yearly throughput capability to $2 million COGS, capable with a staff of 3 per production clean-room. Making it possible to replicate many times over and allowed for unparalleled agility when switching from one product to the next 
• Negotiated sale of company to a private party for an undisclosed amount

headline: Vaccine Development Expert | Designing, Developing, and Testing Novel Vaccines | Organizational Leader
about:
With over ten years of experience in viral vaccine development, I am a passionate and driven scientist who strives to deliver game-changing solutions for global health challenges. I have a PhD in Virology and Immunology, and I was awarded a Fulbright Fellowship to pursue my doctoral studies in the United States. I have a strong record of scientific achievements and productivity, with multiple publications, and honors in the field of virology and immunology.

As a Senior Director of Preclinical Viral Vaccine Development at Icosavax, Inc., I led the design and evaluation of VLP-based vaccine candidates and adjuvants for influenza and other viral diseases, working with internal and external partners to advance them from research to development. I also set up and carried out the strategy for the influenza vaccine program, integrating cutting-edge vaccine science with practical considerations for timely development, efficient production, and global implementation. I have extensive experience in drug discovery, systems biology, assay development, biomarkers, clinical research, and clinical testing activities, using non-human primates and mice as animal models of pathogenicity. I have also managed matrix multidisciplinary teams, demonstrating leadership, communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. I am committed to advancing the science and practice of viral vaccine development, and I seek to leverage my expertise and network to contribute to the development of safe and effective vaccines for the benefit of humanity.

experience.position: Senior Director Preclinical Viral Vaccine Development
experience.description:
Objectives
•	Develop vaccine candidates and drive them through pre-clinical validation to advance from research and into development
•	Translate vaccine programs’ strategic goals into operational plans
•	Work with internal and external partners to design and evaluate VLP-based vaccine candidates and adjuvants in animal models
•	Responsible for monitoring project activities and support critical-path functions to advance preclinical programs
•	Set up and carry out the strategy for the influenza vaccine program and support other viral vaccine programs.
•	Design, carry out, interpret, and communicate experiments that integrate cutting edge influenza vaccine science with working knowledge of the current influenza vaccine seasonal update and pandemic response systems to support development of a VLP-based influenza vaccine with consistently superior efficacy.
•	Lead the technical team responsible for the successful design, execution, analysis, and documentation of analytical assays that will support the influenza vaccine program.
•	Serve as an influenza subject matter expert in the influenza vaccine program.
•	Contribute broadly to the work of the group, including supervision of junior colleagues, research into multiple viral vaccine candidates, management of laboratory activities and fulfillment of compliance obligations.
•	Provide expert input into communication about the influenza vaccine program in internal documents and external patent applications, regulatory submissions, scientific papers and other communications.

ACCOUNTABILITIES:  
•	Help define criteria for advancing programs through preclinical development
•	Identify potential external collaborations
•	Define and execute internal studies
•	Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors on development projects. 
•	Cooperate and grow with the scientific team and the broader company at large

experience.position: Senior Director Analytical Development Cell & Gene Therapy
experience.location: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States

experience.description:
	I report directly to the VP/CSO of the Viral Vaccines Group. Currently working on an RNA-based vaccine against influenza and Covid-19. Design, carry out, interpret, and communicate experiments that integrate cutting edge vaccine science with working knowledge of the current influenza vaccine seasonal update and pandemic response systems to deliver a game-changing influenza vaccine with consistently superior efficacy. Vaccine candidate must also be practical for timely development, efficient production, reliable strain change, and global implementation.
	Independent assessment of vaccine science, collaboration across a matrix organization to advance the vaccine candidate through research an into early development. Work with external parties in collaborations to advance an influenza vaccine candidate and ensure that the vaccine can be integrated into the global influenza vaccine system. Also work on other viral vaccine candidates. Contribute to and carry out the strategy for the influenza vaccine program and other viral vaccine programs.
	Serve as an influenza subject matter expert on the Vaccine Research Influenza project team, providing expert input into experimental design, execution, and interpretation.
	Interact extensively with other Research functions and non-Research functions in advancing in advancing the vaccine through research and into early development.
	Provide expert input into communication about the influenza vaccine program in internal Pfizer documents and external patent applications, regulatory submissions, scientific papers, and other communications.
	Collaborate with external alliance partners for influenza vaccines, including collaborating companies, government agencies and non-governmental organizations. Contribute broadly to the work of the Viral Vaccines group, including the supervision of junior colleagues, research into multiple viral vaccine candidates, management of the laboratories, and fulfillment of compliance obligations.

experience.position: Deputy Director, Viral Vaccines, Global Clinical Immunology
experience.description:
	Growing, titration and production of Zika and Dengue virus stocks. Development of human cell-based assay to determine Zika cell preference and replication status under GLP conditions.
	Development of hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA) using guinea pig red blood cells to determine specific seroconversion of antibody titers in sera samples from humans infected with influenza virus under GLP conditions.
	Dengue assay qualification, validation and transfer under GLP conditions.

	Direct the scientific team, providing scientific and managerial supervision, in addition to the design, implementation and oversight of methods required to support various stages of viral vaccine development. 
	Oversee clinical testing activities, scheduling and general management of personnel, review of data generated, understanding of and compliance to project timelines, monitoring method stability/performance over time.
	Develop, qualify, validate and troubleshoot assays, optimization of processes, evaluation of new technologies to improve sample throughput, precision, quality, and/or accuracy that provide/maintain a competitive advantage and support the various stages of vaccine development. Managed and supervised a team of 40 direct reports.
	Supervise, train, and motivate junior scientists, lab analysts to perform assigned tasks.

	Developed cell-based assay and RT-qPCR assay to determine activity of new small molecules 
        against influenza.
	Developed high throughput system to screen libraries to discover new small molecules using a 
        fluorescent influenza reporter to determine the status of virus replication.
	Developed cell-based assay to determine virus replication of influenza and RSV. Discovered 
        new host targets by using RNA-seq and microarrays as well as micro RNAs and long non- 
        coding RNAs analysis. Verified these observations by RNAi method.
	Served as project leader in a collaboration between Roche and Mount Sinai to discover broad 
        spectrum antivirals against influenza and other respiratory viruses as well as to identify and 
        characterize host factors for drug targeting.
	Led multidisciplinary cross-functional pharma teams that consistently accomplished goals at 
        the specified timelines.
	Identified compounds that inhibited virus replication. Hit validation and hit characterization are 
        in progress.
	Discovered candidate host factors as novel targets against influenza and respiratory syncytial 
        virus in a human lung cell line by integrating two network analysis methods to prioritize host 
        restriction factors for influenza infection by integration of public protein-protein interactor 
        data, siRNA assay data, public microarray expression data and internal RNa-seq data.
	Developed and optimized an RT-qPCR assay in a human lung cell line for the screening of 
        compounds that inhibit influenza A and B virus replication.
	Analyzed and interpreted RNA-seq and micro array data.
	Developed an assay using human primary bronchial epithelial cells to study innate immunity 
        during inhibition of viral replication and the side effects of tested compounds in the system.
	Set up protocols for the HTS/HCS of compounds that inhibit influenza virus replication.

experience.companyName: University of Washington, School of Medicine, Department of Microbiology & Immunology
experience.description:
•	Discovered that metalloproteinases and inflammation induction are associated in lethal Ebola 
        infection in mice.
•	Discovered that dysregulation of inflammatory response and lipoxing signaling allowed lethal 
        dissemination of highly pathogenic H5N1 influenza virus in mice.
•	Discovered that early dysregulation of the inflammatory response is lethal in macaques 
        infected with resurrected influenza 1918 virus.
•	Elucidated the survival mechanism of MX-1 mice infected with the resurrected 1918 influenza 
        virus.
•	Discovered that Stat1 protects the Central Nervous System following HSV-1 corneal infection 
        in mice.
Heavily involved in Systems biology analysis of host immune response to pathogenic human viral infections using animal models. 
	Ebola project: Study aimed at understanding Ebola virus pathogenesis using a mouse model of pathogenesis using wild type and mutant viruses generated by reverse genetics and to elucidate molecular signatures associated with lethality and recovery.
	Influenza studies: Worked in several concurrent Influenza studies using mice and non-human primates as models of infection with the aim to determine the molecular mechanisms of pathogenicity of 1918 pandemic virus and several H5N1 viruses.

publications.title: Nucleolar Relocalization of RBM14 by Influenza A Virus NS1 Protein
publications.description: Viruses utilize a number of host factors in order to carry out their replication cycles. Influenza A virus (IAV) and human respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) both infect the tissues of the respiratory tract, and as such we hypothesize that they might require similar host factors. Several published genome-wide screens have identified putative IAV host factors; however, there is significant discordance between their hits. In order to build on this work, we integrated a variety of "OMICS" data sources using two complementary network analyses, yielding 51 genes enriched for both IAV and RSV replication. We designed a targeted small interfering RNA (siRNA)-based assay to screen these genes against IAV under robust conditions and identified 13 genes supported by two IAV subtypes in both primary and transformed human lung cells. One of these hits, RNA binding motif 14 (RBM14), was validated as a required host factor and furthermore was shown to relocalize to the nucleolus upon IAV infection but not with other viruses. Additionally, the IAV NS1 protein is both necessary and sufficient for RBM14 relocalization, and relocalization also requires the double-stranded RNA (dsRNA) binding capacity of NS1. This work reports the discovery of a new host requirement for IAV replication and exposes a novel example of interplay between IAV NS1 and the host protein, RBM14.IMPORTANCE Influenza A virus (IAV) and respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) present major global disease burdens. There are high economic costs associated with morbidity as well as significant mortality rates, especially in developing countries, in children, and in the elderly. There are currently limited therapeutic options for these viruses, which underscores the need for novel research into virus biology that may lead to the discovery of new therapeutic approaches. This work extends existing research into host factors involved in virus replication and explores the interaction between IAV and one such host factor, RBM14.

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: April 18, 2025, Derreck was senior to Malay but didn't manage Malay directly
receivedRecommendations.description:
I had the privilege of supporting Derreck as his finance business partner during his time as VP of Transportation, and I can confidently say he is one of the most impactful operational leaders I’ve worked with.

Over a period of 1–2 years, we partnered closely to deliver tens of millions of dollars in transportation savings—an achievement that wouldn’t have been possible without his strategic clarity, operational discipline, and relentless focus on execution. Derreck has a rare ability to drive complex business strategies forward by aligning cross-functional teams and pushing people to bring out their best.

Even though I didn’t report to him directly, the impact of his leadership extended well beyond his direct team. His mastery of the OKR model brought not just structure and precision, but a culture of accountability and alignment that influenced how I approached my own work.

What sets Derreck apart is his resilience and calm in the face of complexity and change. No matter how dynamic the business environment became, he led with focus, composure, and a solutions-first mindset. He also has a genuine commitment to team development—he pushes people to grow, leads by example, and creates space for others to stretch and succeed.

Derreck is a true testament to what capable leadership looks like—he can maneuver through complicated changes in business and strategy and still deliver more than what’s committed. If you’re looking for someone who can not only execute strategy and deliver results, but also influence the entire chain through a culture-first approach, then he’s your person

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: March 19, 2025, Xing reported directly to Derreck
receivedRecommendations.description:
As Director of Supply Chain Technology at Saks Global, I reported to Derreck in his role as VP of Transportation.

Derreck fostered a culture of continuous improvement within our supply chain, emphasizing visibility, accountability, and innovation across departments. He was not only willing to embrace calculated risks but also leveraged strategic decision-making to drive efficiency and cost savings. His leadership in carrier selection and supply chain optimization directly contributed to tens of millions of dollars in annual cost reductions during my tenure.

Beyond his operational expertise, Derreck was an exceptional leader and mentor. He created an open environment where I felt encouraged to share ideas and concerns, knowing they would be heard and considered. He actively supported my career growth, ensuring I was engaged in strategic planning and long-term visioning. His feedback was always fair and leveled, and empowered me to think differently and push for better.

I highly recommend Derreck as a supply chain leader, and I will always champion his success—both professionally and as a friend.

headline: Designated Broker Owner Chris Gurnee Home Selling Team
about:
At eXp Realty, our team's dedication to luxury real estate in the Seattle market has cemented our role as frontrunners, guided by my 21+ years of experience. The trust of our distinguished clientele is a testament to our commitment to delivering above-market results and a concierge-level service that redefines industry standards. Our collective expertise shines in every transaction, earning us a reputation for excellence and client satisfaction.

The core competencies that fuel our success include astute negotiation, innovative marketing, and a deep understanding of the unique Seattle landscape. These skills have been honed through our work with repeat clients and referrals who demand the best. Our mission is steadfast—to provide a seamless, rewarding real estate experience, anchored by our unwavering dedication to our clients' goals and aspirations.

experience.description:
Leading a team with over four decades of real estate experience, Chris Gurnee’s well-established reputation has made him a frontrunner in the Seattle real estate market. As a born-and-raised Seattle native, Gurnee’s success is built on his unparalleled market knowledge, expert negotiation skills, and first-class marketing that sets the standard for luxury in the Seattle marketplace and beyond. As a broker for over 17 years, his business is comprised of many repeat clients and referrals who have had the opportunity to witness his skills firsthand. Distinguished buyers and sellers trust Gurnee to guide them through every step of the transaction process and achieve above-market results under his masterful guidance. Due to transacting nearly 600 plus sales across the entire Seattle area – and successfully representing more than $700 million in real estate – Gurnee has earned a reputation for phenomenal results with both buyers and sellers. He is committed to ensuring those seeking to sell or purchase homes in Seattle can do so in the most enjoyable, hassle-free way possible. 

Gurnee’s greatest honors are his longstanding relationships with his valued clients. They are quick to note his professionalism, attention to detail, unwavering integrity, and relentless drive to deliver unmatched service. He is best known for pinpointing the perfect buyer or property quickly to produce the best results in a timely manner.  His office has received the Five Star Professional award for the past four years, which recognizes top-notch customer service in the industry as voted by members of the community.

His expertise extends beyond traditional home sales – Gurnee also has experience working in a variety of niche markets including investment, multi-family, rehab, pre-foreclosure, REO, and retirement properties.

headline: Chief Product Officer
about: As a visionary entrepreneurial executive, I have a proven track record of driving growth and transforming businesses. With extensive experience across merchandising, marketing, sales, e-commerce, and supply chain management, I’ve led teams at iconic brands like Filson, KUIU, Dakine, and Nike, driving transformational business growth.

experience.description: As the Chief Product Officer at Pelican, I spearhead the product strategy and innovation for our diverse product portfolio, while also overseeing all marketing initiatives. By fostering close collaboration with cross-functional teams I ensure that our product development and marketing initiatives are driven seamlessly from concept to launch.

experience.position: Senior Vice President Merchandising and Marketing

experience.description:
As the Chief Merchandising Officer I was responsible for all aspects of the product merchandising, product creation, and supply chain strategies to drive revenue growth and efficiencies for KUIU.  In addition I oversaw all of the brand marketing efforts for the last year developing KUIU’s brand and key product go to market strategies.  Key accomplishments include:

Launched three new incremental product lines driving significant incremental revenue and customer acquisition growth.

Re-set the product creation human resource model to drive “functional excellence” across the core competencies of product design, product management, product development, and color/materials.

Developed three year strategic product pipeline to accelerate KUIU’s position as the innovation leader in performance hunting

Partnered with an external creative agency to deliver KUIU’s first ever brand platform and internal brand playbook.  

Implemented product lifecycle and product franchise management framework to extend and protect the core revenue drivers for the company

Diversified KUIU's key components of the apparel supply chain from a vertical to a factory direct model increasing product margins and delivery times.

Recruited and hired key talent to deliver world class product and supply chain excellence.
Responsible for the identification and creation of the KUIU product portfolio to fuel rapid growth across all retail channels.

experience.position: Global Vice President of Product & Marketing
experience.description: Lead all aspects of Dakine's product creation and global marketing efforts.  At Dakine our mission is to create unique products that are meaningful to the global community of riders, to build and nurture deep relationships with that community, and inspire those who want to join them.  Founded in Haiku, Maui HI in 1979 and located at the base of Mt. Hood in Hood River, Oregon, Dakine offers a complete range of innovative and quality products, including outerwear, sport-specific and lifestyle-driven backpacks, bags, travel gear and accessories. DAKINE products are available for purchase at specialty sports retailers worldwide. For more information visit, www.dakine.com.

experience.position: Global Vice President of Apparel, Equipment, and Accessories
experience.description:
Led Dakine's product creation offense across apparel, equipment, and accessories.  Key accomplishments include:
• Successfully commercialized 650 products every months across multiple categories and five sports
• Led team of 24 employees and five contractors across all aspects of product creation
• Successfully launched the new product category of mountain bike protection delivering over $500k of revenue and earning multiple industry awards
• Partnered with merchandising to create a global integrated go to market process driving product alignment for a consistent product story

Led all aspects of Dakine’s apparel product creation strategy.  Key achievements included:
•	Re-located Outerwear product creation from Irvine, CA to Hood River, OR
•	Re-Set outerwear product strategy and aesthetic resulting in a +42% revenue growth
•	Drove new sourcing strategy resulting in premium product execution and gross margin expansion
•	Reduced style and sku counts 21% to drive efficient product lines and a distinct product point of view

experience.position: Senior Global Business Director Nike Action Sports Apparel
experience.description:
Recruited to revitalize skateboard / snowboard apparel business. Handle all aspects of strategic planning, branding, operations, product development, materials selection / sourcing, and product merchandising.
	•	Created new aesthetic for all skateboard and snowboard apparel, rebranding entire collection to create distinct Nike product positioning emphasizing performance, action, and innovation.
	•	Drove 3 consecutive quarters of year-over-year sales growth, increasing annual revenues by 12%.
	•	Reduced style count 35%, increasing productivity 23% while improving brand clarity.
	•	Developed 3-year strategic plan, setting vision and financial / operational targets.
	•	Implemented human resources planning framework for key leadership positions.

experience.position: SENIOR GLOBAL BUSINESS DIRECTOR/INNOVATION DIRECTOR – ACTION SPORTS
experience.description:
Led global footwear, apparel, and product innovation strategies for $480M Action Sports division. Managed $6M budget and oversaw 37 employees. 
	•	Chosen to create and lead Action Sports Innovation Team, representing firm’s only standalone innovation initiative at the category / division level.
	•	Increased revenues from $394M in 2010 to $483M in 2012 (CAGR = 11%) by revamping product line and prioritizing international growth. 
	•	Expanded gross margins by 400 bps (footwear) and 1100bps (apparel) from 2010 to 2012 by promoting smart product design, optimizing materials sourcing strategy, and revising pricing structure.
	•	Pared apparel collection from 600 styles in 2009 to 200 styles in 2012, driving production efficiencies while creating more targeted consumer messaging.
	•	Created 3-year strategic plan for footwear and apparel business lines, laying pathway for future sales growth and improved profitability while establishing framework for continuous product innovation.
	•	Developed long-term materials sourcing strategy, traveling to Thailand, Vietnam, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and China to build relationships with suppliers / inspect factories.
