headline: CEO at Northwest Harvest
about: Experienced Chief Executive Officer with a demonstrated history of working in the civic & social organization industry. Skilled in Corporate Social Responsibility, Rural Development, International Relations, Management, and Philanthropy. Focused on the intersection between market-based solutions and social justice with a MBA focused in International Business from Temple University - Fox School of Business and Management.

experience.description:
Northwest Harvest works to achieve equitable access to nutritious food for all in Washington. 

We launched an early response to COVID-19 induced food insecurity, fostering coordination across government agencies and between nonprofit organizations. 

Northwest Harvest has been named Washington Organization of the Year for 2021.

experience.position: Vice President - Program, Partnerships and Learning
experience.description:
Led teams to address poverty and other forms of injustice globally. 

Social enterprise; Gender Equality and Women's Empowerment; Food and Nutrition Security; Sexual, Reproductive and Maternal Health; Girls Education; Water and Sanitation. Grew total portfolio value to more than $700 Million from $450 Million. 

Expanding strategic relationships with donors, universities, NGOs to deliver lasting solutions.

experience.position: Regional Director - Middle East and North Africa
experience.description: As Regional Director, I provided leadership and oversight to CARE's Middle East and North Africa program operations including regional Syria response; South Caucasus; Yemen; OPT; and Egypt. I led the implementation of the MENA regional strategy - a model strategy for working across the Middle East and North Africa to advance women's empowerment, opportunities for youth and effective response operations for displaced populations.

I was responsible for the management of CARE’s $6 million portfolio in the South Caucasus. My duties included program design, fundraising, government and donor relations, strategic oversight and day-to-day management. CARE Caucasus developed an innovative model to identify great ideas that tackle social injustice and then mobilize investment to support local people implementing sustainable strategies under my leadership. CARE Caucasus pioneered the practice at CARE of offering consulting services to support others who wish to engage in rural development across the region.

experience.position: Deputy Regional Director, Asia Regional Management Unit
experience.description:
In this role, I provided management oversight in the areas of administrative systems, IT and human resources to CARE country operations throughout Asia. 
Additionally, I provided expertise to $100+ million annual program portfolio on managing donor funding from U.S. Government, European Governments, Foundations, Private Sector to ensure objectives are met while complying with rules and regulations. 
I evaluated financial and operational risk and worked with CARE country offices to identify and implement risk reduction strategies.
Recognizing that strategy and systems are only as good as the people who lead them, I promoted talent management to harness knowledge and retain key staff for sustained strengthening of CARE International in Asia.
I provided leadership of Asia's Program Quality Working Group as a steering committee member.
I founded the Asia Private Sector Working Group for CARE International. 
During this period I undertook several special assignments including: Acting Country Director - Nepal; Aligning organizational structure - Yemen; Strategic Review - Jordan

After being appointed to a role in Asia, but prior to moving, I was tasked by CARE to restructure the $140 million/year resource development division of CARE USA to align with the new organizational strategy.
After thorough analysis and consultation I recommended the elimination of outdated geographic-focused management structures that impeded the implementation of national strategies to mobilize staff and investments according to size of the opportunity.
Through donor segmentation analysis, the team I led identified three donor segments yielding at least $60 for every dollar invested and proposed dramatic increases in investment for those segments.
The recommendations ensured the financial viability of the new operating structure by funding all new staff and activities from costs savings resulting from rectifying inefficient resource allocations.

experience.position: Executive Director of Development, Western Region
experience.description:
In this role at CARE, I had P/L responsibility for a $10 million annual revenue stream. Revenues nearly tripled during my tenure.
With my team, I developed a durable strategy and executable plan to acquire new high capacity donors for the Western region. The major gift market was developed though relationship building with individuals, foundations and corporations in the Western United States - results exceeded $50 million in private donor funds raised. 
I leveraged internal CARE partnerships with program, human resources, finance, and international operations to create mutually beneficial exchanges of knowledge, technical capacity and financial resources and increased awareness of CARE in critical markets across the West through collaborative efforts with external partners.
I worked on educating elected officials on pro-poor international policy via the Care Action Network which resulted in favorable congressional votes, floor speeches and greater influence for CARE.

I was responsible for strategic and operational decision making, managing cash flow, P/L.
During my tenure I advanced the scientific research, rehabilitation of native species, and overall visitor experience for National Parks in Washington State by linking donors to priority projects in need of funding.
I was hired as the first development director for the organization and developed a disciplined and systematic approach to direct marketing, high net-worth individual giving and special events.
I was promoted to the position of executive director by the board and tasked with improving the general health of the organization.
I partnered with an engaged board of directors to engineer a successful turn around plan, rescuing the organization from crisis. This included re-negotiating vendor contracts, restructuring the organization and launching a fundraising campaign which resulted in a return to positive cash flow.

As a member of the senior management team, I supported the strategy development and execution for one of the first social purpose venture agencies in the San Francisco Bay Area.
I worked closely with the board of directors to develop and execute successful, mission-aligned fundraising strategies.
I managed the development of the agency's branded messaging (case statement, brochures, newsletters, website).

headline: Sr. EHS Specialist | Emeritus - Boeing AISES Focal  | Emeritus - President Enterprise Boeing Employee Indigenous Network
about:
A career EHS professional with experience in safety and health program implementation, employee hazard evaluations, regulatory compliance, safety and health training, and illness/injury case management. Extensive knowledge of the OSHA requirements, policies, and directives required by various standard setting organizations. Uniquely experienced in resolving technical issues in keeping with customer milestones. Familiar with EHS issues pertaining to a variety of industries and operations: semiconductor, wind energy, construction, coal mining, oil/gas, and environmental clean up. Proven ability in multi-tasking in a high profile work environments. Effective EHS communicator and team player.

Specialties: Governing Regulations CFR 1910 & 1926, SEMI Standards, Safety Program Management, Accident Investigation, Case Management, Field Auditing, Time Management, Decision Making, Emergency Response, Incident Command, Behavior Based Safety, Coaching, Hazard Analysis, and Clean Room Equipment Process Tools Sign Off

publications.title: The House to Ourselves: Reinventing Home Once the Kids Are Grown
publications.description: Parents with grown children represent one of the largest demographic groups in the country today, and their living needs are often radically different from when they were raising families or working full-time. Architects are responding with innovative solutions to the demand for homes designed for two but with room for more. This book, featuring hundreds of color photos and illustrations, covers renovations and remodels, brand-new homes, and even new types of communities throughout the U.S. Ideas vary from single-level designs to accommodate the physical needs of people as they grow older, to flexible open-floor plans that welcome visitors and allow plenty of socializing. "The House to Ourselves helps boomers explore a wealth of possibilities.

From a technical perspective, her work is sound and thorough, delivering on key initiatives time and time again. Her pragmaticism kept projects on budget and on time, while her unwavering inclination to support those around her continued to propel cross-functional efforts toward progress, no matter the obstacles. Her well of knowledge runs deep, and its beneficiaries are widespread.

It was a joy to work with Leah, and a privilege to learn from her. She has been a pillar of support for countless teams and team members, and she has left an indelible mark on both the culture and operations of Rad Power Bikes. Her technical expertise, cross-functional comprehension, and dedication to her team and those around her make her a collaborator and leader of a rare caliber. She brings with her impressive experience, an immense portfolio of success, and a skillset that she continues to expand and hone with every opportunity, and I cannot wait to see what she does next with it.

headline: Senior Technology Leader (CIO/SVP/VP) | Former VP at Starbucks | Expertise in Digital Transformation, Mobile & Cloud Solutions, E-Commerce, Engineering, User Experience & Digital Workplace
about:
As a senior technology leader with 25 years of multi-faceted industry experience, I have dedicated my career to driving business growth and transformation through innovative digital solutions. My journey has spanned leadership roles across top-tier organizations, including serving as the VP of Digital Engineering and VP of Employee Engineering at Starbucks, and consulting for leading brands like Marriott and Sweetgreen through my company, Fitch Technology and User Experience LLC.

My expertise lies at the intersection of technology and business, where I excel in digital engineering, mobile development, cloud infrastructure, e-commerce, design thinking, and process reinvention. I have a deep understanding of emerging technology and business trends, which enables me to design and implement solutions that not only meet current needs but also anticipate future demands.

In particular, during my 17 years at Starbucks, I was instrumental in leading numerous innovative technology and digital transformation initiatives that had a profound impact on both customer and employee experiences. Notable achievements include:

►  Scaling the Starbucks Card digital reload platform from $10M to $7B.

►  Leading engineering teams to deliver Mobile Pay, which was the largest proximity payment service until 2023, only surpassed by Apple Pay.

►  Driving the development of Mobile Ordering in 2014, which now accounts for over 30% of Starbucks' North American revenue.

►  Integrating the My Starbucks Rewards program with engineering solutions, contributing to over 50% of Starbucks' North American revenue.

►  Spearheading the digital transformation of the employee experience, significantly improving technology engagement scores from 39% to 70% within two years.


In closing, whether it’s optimizing franchise technology, leading complex digital transformations, or pioneering new approaches to technology operations, my goal is to deliver measurable outcomes that drive value for both the business and its customers.  The scope of my experience spans numerous industry segments – with heavy emphasis on Retail, Hospitality, E-Commerce, Education, and Consumer Goods – and I’m always happy to chat with any individuals or organizations facing challenges within my areas of expertise!

experience.companyName: Fitch Technology and User Experience Consultancy
experience.description:
Sweetgreen
Partnering with the CTO of this 250+ location publicly traded healthy food chain to provide guidance related to a pivotal digital transformation scheduled for launch in 2025; efforts to date have included leading the company's product and design teams through an e-commerce mobile app redesign and drastic UX simplification, advising on IT-driven personalization strategies, assisting with development of a new customer loyalty program to uplevel the brand experience, and deploying strategies to help maximize ticket size and order completion %

Marriott International
Retained on the SVP of Technologies’ staff of this $60B global hospitality leader to develop an IT transformation plan focused on dramatically improving the company's capabilities in IT Infrastructure Management, Technical Support, Business Intelligence & Analytics, and IT Staff Recruiting/Development

•	Elevated to executive-level role for this industry-leading hospitality chain, spanning $32B in annual revenues and operating 35,000+ retail stores globally; primary mandate of role was to lead the digital transformation of the Starbucks Store Employee Experience—modernizing/simplifying in-store technology and leveraging hand-held devices with cloud infrastructure to dramatically improve staff productivity
•	Created a shared vision across retail operations and technology teams with the store employee at its center; worked across leadership peers to create buy-in, achieve vision alignment, and formulate a multi-year plan that included 1) development of a state-of-the-art mobile app fused into a single pane of glass, streamlining access to labor, inventory, maintenance, and communications data; 2) reduction of in-store device counts from six types to two (iPads/MacBooks); and 3) standardizing all systems around a common OS; and 4) creating an employee mobility software program that dramatically increased in-store collaboration and efficiency
•	Augmented AI/ML capabilities, deploying a series of new AI-driven systems to simplify and optimize store labor deployment based on store format, sales, and sales mix
•	Pioneered a UX research team, culminating in an employee experience Center of Excellence (CoE) that successfully boosted technology engagement scores from 39% to >70%, decreased staff attrition, saved millions of labor hours annually, and reduced waste by up to 2% via use of new paperless solutions 
•	Developed a comprehensive four-part plan for enabling remote work consisting of 1) creation of a shared set of workforce goals and business rhythms; 2) design of new remote work technologies and processes; 3) implementation of cultural changes aimed at embracing telemetry and new measurement tools/practices; and 4) rollout of a change management plan to educate end-users around remote work practices and to build a scalable change discipline

•	Selected for newly created role focused on increasing alignment between the company's technology group and digital, marketing, and operational teams—serving as the chief architect involved in building a joint strategic vision and multi-year plan aimed at continuing to drive the company's thought leadership in the areas of digital payments, mobile ordering, partnerships, and customer loyalty
•	Hired, developed, and mentored over 150 digital architecture and engineering staff/contractors to uplevel the company's IT capabilities and support numerous innovative web, mobile, and platform initiatives
•	Guided teams in achieving global recognition for their innovation in the field of retail digital operations, including serving as the inspiration behind the "Digital Flywheel" concept—a virtuous cycle of how digitally-engaged users become converted into loyal customers. 
•	Held ownership of high-profile digital assets related to the Starbucks Gift card business ($12B/yr in sales/reloads and $1B in gift-card float today), mobile payments (60% of all tender), mobile ordering (29% of US & Canada revenue), and the My Starbucks Rewards loyalty program representing >50% of revenue; additionally forged highly synergic partnerships with Spotify, Chase, Delta Airlines, and other top brands

•	Promoted to director-level role overseeing launch of the Starbucks global website—with heavy focus on the development of localized content, improved UX, advanced ecommerce tools, and enhanced payment and fraud prevention functionality; rolled out the new site to 44 countries, serving >100M customers/mo
•	Established the Starbucks Open API, a groundbreaking platform enabling trusted third parties to leverage Starbucks' public dataset; this platform served as the foundation for unlocking key digital partnerships with prominent entities such as Chase, Spotify, Lyft, Delta Airlines, and others
•	Launched the first-ever Starbucks mobile app, enabling mobile payment functionality, a foundational digital capability that led to development of the largest proximity mobile payment system in North America
•	Modernized numerous additional processes and best practices— including championing the adoption of Agile & DevOps methodology to accelerate project delivery, quality, innovation, and workstream alignment

Championed key technology pivots within the company to capitalize on emerging e-commerce trends and the explosion of digital technology (mobile and handheld devices); efforts included revitalizing the existing web/mobile team and recruiting top talent from personal network, growing the team to 15 by Y-1 alone
•	Subsequently expanded the team to 100 staff by 2017 focused on securing Starbucks' leadership position by offering unsurpassed CX capabilities including mobile ordering solutions and the ability to easily purchase/reload Gift Cards—a key element in the company's growth from $10M in 2005 to $6B in 2017

I bring 30+ years of experience operating, designing, delivering, selling and servicing distributed systems, server and mobile software now at Atlassian, formerly at Facebook, Starbucks, Amazon, Cisco and Microsoft.

At Starbucks, my teams built all mobile, web, and in store ordering, commerce, digital gifting, rewards and partnerships with Google, Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, and other technology partners. 
At Cisco, we built a federated cloud of clouds for the Intercloud.
At Amazon Web Services, my teams built and operated the CloudFront Content Delivery Network, Route 53 Domain Name Service across a global network of 52+ locations.  CloudFront can be used to deliver your entire website, including dynamic, static and streaming content. 
At Microsoft my experience included operating Microsoft’s premier homepage, http://www.msn.com, http://my.msn.com, the login page for Hotmail, and the MSN Today website which all MSN Messenger users access.  
•	Delivered three v1 through v2 product releases including three major releases of Speech Server. 
•	Extended an existing desktop sync product and turning it into a v1 server product (Server ActiveSync) while continuing development of the desktop product ActiveSync 3.5 to support the next release of the PocketPC and SmartPhone
•	Shipped: IE 4, TaxSaver 99, TaxSaver UK, PocketPC 2002, ActiveSync 3.5, Server ActiveSync 1.0 in MIS 1.0, MSN 8.0 Homepage, MyMSN, MSN 9.0 Homepage, Speech Server 2004 and Speech Server 2004 R2. 
•	Twenty+ years of management experience with Software engineering teams to AI, Data Science, Data Engineering, Researchers, Consultants, CPAs and Designers.  
•	Six years of direct customer facing consulting and delivery working with a broad range of customers from Fortune 50, to large enterprises to small/medium businesses to government agencies and Telcos.  
•	Passion for creating great services and products that customers embrace and use whether these are Cloud-based, mobile, SaaS, desktop, server, web or custom solutions for consumers, enterprise and corporate customers.
Specialties: Public/Hybrid Cloud Computing, Distributed Systems, Server software, Mobile, General Management, P&L, sales, consulting, CDN, DNS, operating at Internet scale.

Our people products are built from the ground up on top of Meta infrastructure and make all employees, managers, HR professionals, and recruiters better by providing software-based insights and products that streamline recruiting and feedback, develop skills, performance management and support healthy organizations with intelligent data-driven decisions. The team builds and operates the largest and most robust mobile ecosystem of any retailer in the world, serving over 90 million customers per week with more than 14 million Starbucks Rewards members, eight million mobile paying customers, with one out of three now using Mobile Order & Pay, and more than $6 billion loaded onto prepaid Starbucks Cards in North America during 2016 alone.
Co-founded stealth mode security startup.

Techstars provides seed funding from over 75 top venture capital firms and angel investors who are vested in the success of a startup, as well as intense mentorship from hundreds of the best entrepreneurs in the world.

As publicly stated Cisco invested $1B to build and publicly launch its expanded cloud business along with Telstra, Deutsche Telekom and 58 other partners with over 350 data centers across 50 countries. Together with its partners, Cisco is building the Intercloud -- a globally connected network of clouds. Architected for the IoE, Cisco's Intercloud is designed for high-value application workloads, real-time analytics, "near-infinite" scalability and compliance with local data sovereignty laws. By building the world's largest network of clouds, Cisco's vision is to deliver the most comprehensive and easy-to-provision-and-consume marketplace of hybrid-ready cloud services.  The Cisco Intercloud is built upon industry-leading Cisco cloud technologies and leverages OpenStack for its open standards-based global infrastructure. It supports any workload, on any hypervisor and interoperates with any cloud. My team is responsible for designing, developing and delivering Cisco’s public cloud offerings to customers and working with external partners and Cisco business units in porting on premise offers to SaaS offers. The team is building an industry-leading, global cloud platform for IaaS that allows for hosting production SaaS and PaaS workloads.

experience.position: General Manager - Amazon CloudFront and Amazon Route 53
experience.description:
I was responsible for the P&L, customer acquisition, overall development, operations, management and product direction of the Amazon CloudFront Content Delivery Network and Amazon Route 53 Global Domain Name Service. 
Amazon CloudFront is a global content delivery web service with 49+ edge locations worldwide. CloudFront integrates with other Amazon Web Services to give developers and businesses an easy way to distribute static, dynamic content and video to end-users with low latency, high data transfer speeds. There are no long term contracts or required minimum commitments - you pay only for as much or as little content as you actually deliver through the service. Since launching publicly in November, 2008 CloudFront has added a wide variety of customer requested features including private content, streaming media content (both live and on-demand), invalidation, and custom origins. Amazon CloudFront had over 20,000 active paying customers by November, 2011 doubling the number of customers from the same time the previous year. You can learn more from the CloudFront presentation link below. Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable DNS service designed to give developers and businesses a reliable and cost effective way to route end users to Internet applications. 
I had several other teams that are not yet public but also hiring. Of these, the Elastic Transcoding Service is now also publicly available.  
If you are interested in learning more, you can watch this video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMBhWk0z7og

My expertise in risk assessment, asset protection, and fraud investigation has consistently led to the successful resolution of high-impact cases and improved organizational security posture.

Operational Excellence & Risk Mitigation:

I've helped many organizations reduce threats by developing strong investigation plans, identifying weaknesses, and improving security checks. At COMC, I handled a large annual budget, aligning financial resources with company priorities and strengthening security. 

Leadership & Team Development: 
I am passionate about mentoring teams, and fostering a culture of collaboration and security excellence. At King County Sheriff’s Office, I provided mentorship and guidance on investigations. My leadership has resulted in improved team performance and more efficient case resolution, ensuring optimal outcomes for organizations and their assets.

I’m passionate about executing high-impact projects to drive growth, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

Though I have 10+ years of experience in COO roles, I’ve also developed experience as a certified Human Resources professional, empowering executive teams to develop greater leadership and enhance team performance.


AREAS OF EXPERTISE:

•	Human Resources, Operations and Logistics

•	Building High-Performing Teams
•	Stakeholder Management and Client Relationships

NOTABLE CONTRIBUTIONS:

•	Developed cultural initiative exceeding the Total Premium target by an exceptional 168%, surpassed the plan for under 5-year production, and exceeded overall goals by over 70%. 
•	Negotiated the acquisition of a distribution service company, securing an exclusive distribution channel and leading to a 125% increase in production for primary companies.
•	Drove 65% expansion of customer portfolio and increased revenue by 387% within a 12-month period.
•	Developed and implemented a Culture and Diversity Plan, improving the hiring of women and diverse candidates by more than 20% and diverse representation by 30%, earning the Northwestern Mutual D and I Excellence Award 
•	Selected by peers, earning the 2021 Northwestern Mutual Emerald Award.
•	Spearheaded operational growth of 125% for a media company.


WHAT MANAGERS AND PEERS SAY ABOUT ME:

•	“Ultimately, the client experience dictates how our service and training departments function. Felix leads his team to think through their roles always keeping the client experience top of mind.”
•	“Felix led the hiring of multiple individuals in the agency, and those hires will help shape the culture of the office moving forward.”

In all of these leadership projects, he did an exceptional job despite his newness to the firm and industry. Felix is a huge asset to the firm.”

CONTACT:

experience.description:
Collaborates with senior leadership to develop and execute strategic plans aimed at identifying key priorities, enabling the Network Office Leadership Team to effectively achieve business objectives. Leads cross-functional teams to execute strategic initiatives. Spearheads strategic planning, infrastructure development, and operational management for the Network Office, ensuring its financial vitality and expansion. Creates and enhances the operational cadence of the business and refines performance monitoring systems to anticipate requirements, taking the lead in conducting routine business review procedures.

I was hired on as COO in Seattle and then the world went on lockdown 11 days later. I had not even finished my initial training when I was already making decisions with my Managing Partner on how to lead our team in those uncertain times. 

Washington was the first state to approve a lockdown, so we had no precedent in that office or the company. This was a business that did not know how to operate remotely, as their day-to-day was all in-person (Insurance & Investments). We also had to manage the morale in our office and pay attention to their needs, as they had never done before. I reached out to others in the Home Office to receive all the information needed to continue my (self) training in the company and the industry.

Assumed responsibilities for operational results and efficiency in all lines of business, while providing overall leadership, guidance, and direction for a team of seven department heads. Fostered multi-functional collaboration, developed a culture of teamwork, and implemented development programs to enhance employee retention. Managed a cross-media content platform, increasing engagement and delivering informative content to target audiences. Identified opportunities for business growth through market analysis, leading to strategic investments, acquisitions, and partnerships. Engaged with internal stakeholders including service operations leadership, home office heads, and executive leadership to communicate plans, strategies, and operational status.

Directed all operational aspects, managing employees and consultants to enhance business operations efficiency and efficacy. Participated in client-facing consulting, translating insights into actionable business opportunities, and providing oversight on implementation progress. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to address priority tactical plans and communicate strategy. Spearheaded the negotiation and implementation of leadership academies for clients, as well as maintaining service level agreements, ensuring prompt and dependable service delivery to stakeholders.

Governed strategic planning and development initiatives, overseeing the formulation and execution of long-term goals and objectives. Worked with senior leadership and stakeholders to develop comprehensive strategic plans aligned with the municipality's vision, mission, and community needs.

Optimized all operational functions, overseeing diverse areas to guarantee smooth and efficient workflow. Supervised cross-functional teams to execute key initiatives and projects, aligning with organizational goals and objectives to drive business growth and profitability. Integrated and tailored various business strategies to optimize operational processes and facilitate expansion.

experience.description:
I’m currently looking to connect with curious and motivated Salesforce technologists in Bogotá and Medellín, and ServiceNow specialists in Guadalajara.

My previous experience as part of a global team included leading recruiting for CX, AdTech/MarTech, Contact Center Transformation, UX, Product, M&A, ESG, and Data Privacy.

· Managed full cycle recruiting for multiple roles across the U.S. and Canada, spanning Cloud Engineering, Data Privacy, CX, XD, Microsoft Center of Excellence, System Integration, Workday, and Healthcare/Life Sciences roles.

· Recruited 95 people between 2020-2021, including 75 CX specialists, driving 289% growth for the global CX team.

· Recruiting Lead for the Systems Integration & Anaplan capabilities – recruited the first 5 people to each capability.

· Contributed to the transformation of Slalom’s first regional delivery team to a global technology team, enhancing recruitment strategies and optimizing interview processes across various capabilities.

· Mentored and trained recruiters across the U.S., Canada, and Australia.

· Onboarding Lead responsible for new hire communications, orientation, and check-ins.

· Partnered with the ID&E and other recruiting teams to facilitate recruiter training courses.

· Mentored Hispanic/LatinX youth in the greater Seattle area through resume reviews and event support.

· Led technical recruiter, managed full cycle recruitment across Orange County and San Diego, spanning Cloud & Software Engineering, Salesforce, CX, and XD roles.

· Attended tech conferences like AWS re:Invent and Dreamforce to network and attract talent.

· Onboarding Lead responsible for facilitating new hire orientation and identifying opportunities to improve onboarding experience.

· Co-facilitated workshops on storytelling and behavioral interviewing.

· Coordinated and promoted Slalom Orange County & San Diego’s yearly premier networking events - drove attendance of 150+ people to each of the four occasions, including candidates and clients.

· Awarded Talent Acquisition Rookie of the Year in 2017.

· Developed and executed recruitment strategies for start-ups and non-profits, collaborating closely with C-level executives to meet critical talent needs.

· Managed full life cycle recruitment for various roles, utilizing email marketing for business development and other innovative sourcing methods.

· Focused on recruiting Software Engineers/Developers, Electrical/Hardware Engineers, Test Engineers, Support Engineers, Data Scientists, UX/UI Designers and more.

· Generated $300,000+ in revenue through successful direct placements, significantly enhancing business development efforts.

· Responsible for full life cycle recruitment of physicians and allied health professionals, which included primary care, psychiatry, urology, obstetrics and gynecology, cardiology, rheumatology, and other specialists.

· Worked directly with hospital executives, VPs, Directors, and in-house recruiters.

· Met with key stakeholders and visited communities to understand recruitment needs.

· Contributed to business development across major healthcare systems in the San Francisco Bay Area and Los Angeles.

· Trained and mentored entry-level recruiters, enhancing team capabilities and recruitment outcomes.

· Developed comprehensive procurement campaigns, including targeted email outreach and cold calling.

· Generated over $1M in revenue through business development and direct placements.

headline: Working to Expand AI Tinkerers Globally
about:
I'm passionate about building bridges between brilliant minds in AI.

As founder of AI Tinkerers, we've connecting tens of thousands of active builders with in-person events in 70+ cities worldwide just in the last 6 months. What makes AI Tinkerers special isn't just global scale—it's curation. Every attendee is screened as an active builder. No pitches and zero fluff. When everyone in the room is worth talking to, magic happens. We're the builders who are setting the pace for the industry.

My entrepreneurial background includes scaling Crowd Cow to $50M+ revenue and founding companies acquired by Upwork and Whitepages. As President of Madrona Venture Labs, we launched Mighty AI (acquired by Uber) and ReplyYes (acquired by Nordstrom). Now I actively invest in and advise early-stage AI startups.

We're living through the most exciting time in history, and the best innovations happen when smart people collaborate on real implementations.
topSkills: Technological Innovation • Artificial Intelligence (AI) • Entrepreneurship • Executive Management • Venture Capital

experience.description:
Crowd Cow's mission is to help people discover and access the highest quality craft beef and meats, and to bring people together - farmers and consumers, families and friends.

This all started when a friend said "I'm so excited! I'm getting my cow this Friday." He then went on to describe how much better the beef tasted and how proud he was to support the farmer directly. I wanted that too — and he wouldn't share! Ethan suggested we create a site to virtually meet the farmer and to crowdfund a single cow. The rest is history.

https://www.crowdcow.com
ThinkFuse, Smore, VendorHawk, ...

Madrona Venture Labs (http://www.madronaventurelabs.com/) is a startup studio funded by Madrona Venture Group. Together with a talented team, we identify opportunities, build the products, get the initial traction, recruit exceptional teams and help secure financing before spinning them out as independent companies.

Our first company, Mighty AI (https://mighty.ai/)was an AI data management platform for autonomous vehicle perception data with funding led by New Enterprise Associates, Foundry Group and Madrona Venture Group and was acquired by Uber.
oDesk acquired MediaPiston in September of 2011.

With MediaPiston, I created a 2-sided crowdsourcing marketplace for high quality content, bootstrapping from scratch to cash-flow positive using minimal resources and no outside funding. The system included a software process control system, home-grown reputation system and hundreds of freelance writers from the US, UK, Canada and around the world. I started this as a solo founder working nights and weekends while still full time in my prior role at WhitePages and over time built a small team of incredibly talented software engineers early in their careers to help.

Within a year or two the kinks had been worked out and we had established a two-sided marketplace with decent liquidity (~$85K / month). Around that time I received interest from each of the two largest online work marketplaces to buy the company to integrate into their marketplaces. It may have been the wrong choice but in the end rather than continue to bootstrap and grow the company organically, I decided to sell MediaPiston to oDesk in September of 2011 where I joined as VP.

After WhitePages acquired Snapvine, I headed up the 55-person technology team covering engineering, operations & IT.  Beyond that, I took on corp dev and hired the company's new head of HR, setting the goals for each of those areas.

Working with the talented team, we set ambitious goals around significantly improving the infrastructure, process, team and culture of engineering:

Process:  moved the company from waterfall to agile and increased the frequency of deployments by over 35x.

Technology:  ported to ruby on rails, rebuilt the entire data center.

Team:  upgraded the tech team throughout, implemented an internship program with close ties to UW CSE and reformed the company's interview process.

Culture:  empowered major decision-making at the individual contributor and lead level, and pushed successfully to rewrite the company's values.  Changed up touch-points including all hands meetings, company lunches, company website and more.
Making sure Snapvine achieves ambitious goals.  Update: sold!

Negotiated deals with J-PHONE, KDDI and NTT DoCoMo to use the Openwave Mobile Browser and related technologies in their products for Japan and European markets.  Spent around 20% of my time in Japan, 80% in Redwood City, CA. Took two years in the middle to get an MBA at MIT Sloan School of Management.
ESPN.com

The last point is not to be under-appreciated. Some people fall prey to the short-term temptation of taking the popular/convenient path of least resistance, even if it is not the right thing to do. Joe is the type of leader who always seeks to do the "right" thing. I give Joe my strongest recommendation as a business partner, entrepreneur, and leader in the tech community.

publications.title: Craft Beef: A Revolution of Small Farms and Big Flavors
publications.description: Why do we know more about the origin and flavor of the coffee beans in our cup of morning brew than about the steak on our dinner table? Why do we delight in the differences between a Zinfandel and a Cabernet, but not even know that breeds like Belted Galloway or Murray Grey exist?  For too long, beef in America has been relegated to commodity status. But a craft beef revolution is underway across America, and it’s delivering better steak. Follow Ethan Lowry, Joe Heitzeberg, and Caroline Saunders as they meet the farmers, butchers, and chefs making the craft beef revolution possible, and along the way, learn how to become a craft beef connoisseur yourself.

headline: Global Trade and Logistics Professional
about:
Global thought leader with a proven history of proactively supporting new markets, improving profits, expanding operational bandwidth, and minimizing supply chain disruptions while establishing audit-readiness systems.

KEY SKILLS:

Proven Strategic Leader		
Results Oriented			
Problem Solver		
Matrixed People Manager
LEAN Creative Thinker 		
International Trade Risk Expert 		
Focused & Flexible	
Training & Audit Skilled
Warehouse & Distribution
Export Letters of Credit
Customs Valuation
Tariff & Non-Tariff Barriers
ERP & Trade Automation Experienced	
Import & Export Expertise		
Logistics Subject Matter Expert

Bilingual – English/Spanish

experience.position: Global Trade Vice President / Group Manager
experience.description: Reported to the Head of Global Trade.  M&A leadership role assisting with the full integration of Lucira Health.  A subject-matter expert (SME) consulted on domestic and international logistics, transportation, warehouse, and distribution matters.

Reported to the Executive VP of Regulatory Audit/Quality Assurance.  Responsible for global import and export operations and audits.  Established and developed key leadership relationships with corporate legal, procurement, logistics, tax, marketing, and sales.  Global oversight and daily management of Customs Brokers, Freight Forwarders, and Express Couriers.  Subject-Matter Expert (SME) consulted on domestic and international logistics, transportation, warehouse, and distribution matters.
•	Reduced U.S. Customs and FDA clearance time from 9 days to 2 days. 
•	Improved import air transit from 5+ days to 2 days by contracting three cargo carriers.
•	Obtained U.S. Customs ruling to protect the zero-duty status of imported products.
•	Launched Canada online business – Logistics and regulatory trade approvals.

Reported to Sr. Vice President of Regulatory Audit/Quality Assurance within the worldwide operations corporate team.  Managed 11 people with global oversight and leadership responsibilities for import and export operations and audit readiness.  Established and developed key leadership relationships with corporate legal, procurement, logistics, tax, marketing, and sales.  Global oversight and daily management of Customs Brokers, Freight Forwarders, and Express Couriers.
•	Championed Customs ruling project resulting in a savings of $2M.
•	Challenged U.S. Customs classification to reduce the cost of goods by $500K annually.
•	Implemented improved internal controls to realize an annual combined import savings of $14M.

experience.position: Director of International Trade Compliance - North America
experience.description:
Reported to the Global Director of Trade compliance in the corporate legal department.  Provided oversight for the strategy and management of all export and import activities with a precision focus on the optimization of free trade agreements, establishment of LEAN practices and key relationships with sales, procurement, finance, accounting, tax, logistics leadership.  Developed and managed a 10 person geographically dispersed team.

•	Jump-started a failing Free Trade Agreement (FTA) program through the implementation of metrics and key performance indicators resulting in the annualized import duty avoidance of $4M and export FTA certifications totaling $8M.

•	Efficiently managed the vetting process to qualify products to be sold to the US Government under the “Buy American Act” program resulting in additional sales of $101M annually.

•	Recognized by corporate leadership for excellent business acumen and trade compliance expertise supporting my selection to lead the export/import due diligence activities related to both M&A and contract reviews.

experience.position: Director of Logistics & Trade Compliance Strategy/LATAM Operations
experience.description:
Reported to the Vice President of Corporate Ethics and Compliance, with oversight and management of a 5-person corporate team and dotted line relationships to over 120 Trade Compliance Ambassadors (TCAs) throughout the globe.  Managed the strategic deployment of LEAN business and export and import compliance controls including; training, internal audit activities with a focus on Latin America operational activities.

•	Established regulatory audits and required operational controls resulting in the annualized savings of $1.2M while improving the Customs clearance time by 62% for all Mexican imports by eliminating the “Previo” inspection program.

•	Created and distributed internal customer “Import Guides” after researching and documenting tariff and non-tariff controls.  These guides were successfully utilized to train internal staff and increased the number of import permits issued by the Argentine Customs and Tax authorities from 40% to over 75%.

Reported to the Sr. Director of Trade within the corporate finance function with oversight and management of a 3-person corporate team and Customs Broker relationships.  Implemented import and export controls for both physical goods and encrypted software solutions for North and South America.  Consistently collaborated with legal, corporate governance, finance, supply chain, business partners, Customs Brokers and Freight Forwarders.  Implemented metrics and key performance management controls.

•	Collaboratively launched Microsoft retail stores throughout Canada and Puerto Rico with thorough collaboration with legal, corporate tax, sales, finance, accounting, and supply chain corporate leadership.

•	Spearheaded the successful timely due-diligence activities related to the M&A purchase of Perceptive Pixel, based out of Portland, Oregon to enhance revenue growth.

•	Partnered with global tax and accounting general ledger teams creating and establishing a best-in-class FCPA (Foreign Corrupt Practices Act) audit program to prevent the illegal bribery of government officials operating through supply chain agents, such as Customs Broker and Freight Forwarders.

Reported to Vice President of Logistics and Technology within worldwide operations corporate team.  Managed a team of 5 people with global oversight and leadership responsibilities for import, export, social responsibility, product safety, hazardous materials and AmazonGlobal.com. Global oversight and daily management of Customs Brokers, Freight Forwarders and Express Couriers.

•	Seamlessly launched AmazonGlobal.com in 23 out of 58-destination country markets; doubling annual revenue by $12M.

•	Reduced costs by $500K through the implementation of a Foreign Trade Zone in the Phoenix, AZ.

•	Pioneered the company’s first formalized product safety program for goods being purchased from Asian suppliers.

•	Identified and implemented the company’s first social responsibility program through a 3rd party consulting group.

•	Orchestrated the company’s first outsourced hazardous materials program to mitigate shipping delays and penalties.

experience.position: Senior Director of Customs & Trade Strategy
experience.description:
Reported to Vice President of Direct Imports and Vice President of Strategic Sourcing with a staff of ~ 50 team members.  Spearheaded and led all aspects of trade compliance import activities, including: analyzing current business and compliance practices, making improvement recommendations, seeking cross-functional senior and executive management approvals and implementing necessary enhancements to reduce the cost of goods, eliminate waste, and ensure import audit readiness.  

•	Established a premier trade program through a foundation built on three master pillars; Highly Trained PEOPLE, Repeatable PROCESSES and Intelligent TRADE INFORMATION SYSTEMS (Export and Import).  

•	Successfully managed and avoided $50M annually through Free Trade Agreements and identified another potential reduction in import duties in excess of an additional $30M.

•	Influenced executive and senior management to grant final approval for an unprecedented capital expenditure of $12M on trade automation software after demonstrating the negative impact of previously ineffective manual controls through the identification of $6M in cash flow leaks while simultaneously uplifting order fulfillment cycle time by 16% (82% to 98%).

•	Implemented an automated three-tier cross training program enabling the career advancement of staff members.

experience.position: Director of International Trade Compliance Program
experience.description:
Reported to the Vice President of International within the finance organization managing all import related activities, including: HTS classification, foreign trade zone, duty drawback, Customs inquiries, selling agent reconciliation, metrics, and internal audit.  Oversight and management of 8 staff members.

•	Accelerated improved cash flow of more than $4M through the successful management of a foreign trade zone.

•	Drove realized savings of $2M a year through an effective duty drawback program.

•	Directed the U.S. Customs C-TPAT project, obtaining admittance into the program and led a supplier factory audit in Italy.

experience.position: Director of Trade, Procurement & Logistics | Corporate Import & Export Compliance Manager
experience.location: San Diego, CA | El Paso, TX
experience.description:
Reported to the Vice President of Quality and Manufacturing and was responsible for logistics, import, warehousing, and procurement.  Directed and managed a team of up to 30 employees.

•	Collaboratively managed and launched implementation of trade automation software under-budget and 3 months early.

•	Built training materials and led global trade automation software training in the U.S., Asia, and Europe.

•	Key team member in the successful launch of a formalized NPIP (New Product Introduction Process) reducing time to market.

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: May 3, 2018, Javier reported directly to John R.
receivedRecommendations.description:
I am honored to write a professional reference for John Soares. I have known John for over five years, after reporting into his team at Microsoft Corp. John is an extremely dedicated and hardworking leader and always leads by example. 

His ability to balance the needs of the business with a best-in-class compliance program is one of John's many developed skillsets. 

It is with high confidence and personal experience that I recommend John for any role in the Logistics and Trade Compliance profession. I have no doubt that he will prove to be an asset to any organization.

I also appreciated his professionalism and dedication to the cause.

about: Passionate & strategic leader with significant experience in business development, health plan partnerships, contracting and account management.

experience.description: Motivo is the largest platform for therapist tele-supervision. We connect healthcare organizations to virtual clinical supervisors to complete the therapist licensure process.

Kaia is the leading provider of a digital-first solution for musculoskeletal and joint pain.  Kaia's conservative care pathway supports patients through AI technology, including cutting edge motion coaching with immediate feedback and body position correction, coupled with human support through a dedicated coach and escalation pathways to virtual PT and / or in-person care.  80%+ get the care they need without the need for in-person PT visits,  chiropractic visits or medication.

Deep behavioral health insights and an integrated proprietary platform identifies and engages the right patients with the right support – when and how they want it.  AbleTo is committed to reach people with unmet behavioral health needs and eliminate barriers through virtual care.

After 4 years of being a road warrior, building Aetna's brand across the west and bringing in new clients for National Accounts, it's time to step back and sleep in my own bed on a regular basis.
While closing out new sales for 2017 through the end of this year, I am now taking on account management responsibilities in the Public & Labor division of Aetna.

experience.position: VP of Business Development, National Accounts
experience.description:
Responsible for new business development, meeting & exceeding sales objectives by aggressively targeting sales opportunities that have the best chance of winning.  Accountable for market place presence, meeting with consultants & prospects to expand the Aetna brand and generate new opportunities.  Accountable for financial performance, profitability, and operating with the Aetna values.

For 2016 added 7 new NA clients into the portfolio for a revenue growth of more than $30+M
For 2017 added 8 new clients for a revenue of more than $32M

experience.position: Sales Vice President, National Accounts, Northwest
experience.description:
Responsible for new customer sales in WA, OR, ID, AK, N. CA and CO.  Responsible for growth and revenue targets across markets, relationship building, and team development.

From 1/1/13 - 1/1/14, I have successfully added 7 new national account clients into our portfolio, for a revenue growth of more than $29.1M.

Responsible for new sales, market growth and client management / existing growth for the Pacific Northwest.

Responsible for cultivating strong, productive and influential relationships with brokers/consultants, customers and peers focusing on the larger, more complex accounts/prospects.

Implements strategies necessary to attain sales objectives in assigned areas.

Manages complex negotiations, Positions products and services to increase sales and maximize revenue.

Manages the integration of client's and Aetna's internal organizations to meet client's installation needs.

Identifies various ways to partner with client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line.  Gains understanding of client's multifaceted needs and makes appropriate recommendations accordingly.

Responsible for managing sales, service and conservation efforts for a book of business across all products and services.  Accountable for achieving growth and earnings targets, as well as managing profitability and budgets.  Played key role in the development of a new patient management model (EMO), including rollout, training and education across the company.  Successful in finding creative solutions to address customer needs.  Currently driving the organization to develop a new clinical model for implementation 1/1/2011.  Manage implementation of new products and services to ensure smooth transition.  Demonstrate strong financial knowledge, industry knowledge and a thorough understanding of strategic direction, as well as financial and operational objectives.

Responsible for closing out all outstanding financial settlements from 1996-1998, collecting over $20 million in receivables from provider groups and hospital organizations.  Responsible for implementing a standard process for all future settlements and creating reports for senior management.  Responsible for data analysis in support of contract negotiations and utilization management.  Significant involvement in the Microsoft Health Improvement Project (HIP).  Key member of management team in strategic planning and cost analysis.  Manage 3 FTEs responsible for contract audits, claims rework and data analysis.

Responsible for analysis and design of all pricing and reimbursement strategies for all company networks.  Direct responsibility for fund pool management, the fund pool system and all pricing files.  Active member of the Financial Risk Review Committee and Reimbursement Subcommittee.  Direct oversight of 10 FTEs.  Coordination with The Regence Group affiliates to develop corporate reimbursement policies and strategies.

experience.position: Regional Manager of Provider Network Development
experience.description: Direct responsibility for network development in 17 counties across Washington and direct oversight of 9 FTEs.  Management of professional contracting, risk contracting, and hospital negotiations for all networks in my region.  Coordination with The Regence Group affiliate plans to manage border county contract and reimbursement issues.  Play key role in development of provider networks, network consolidation efforts, development of risk arrangements and reimbursement models.  Participate in the development of provider contracts, provider manuals and provider communications.

Direct oversight of 28 FTEs and an annual budget of $1.6 million.  Management of provider credentialing and full accountability for the division’s role in achieving NCQA accreditation.  Oversight responsibility for provider file maintenance and provider directory publications.  Play key role in strategic development of provider networks and reimbursement models.  Analyze and ensure compliance with new legislation and state regulations.  Participate in the design and development of new corporate level systems to consolidate multi-state databases and processes, including the establishing of common business practices among participants.  Represent Regence BS in corporate level consolidation discussions.  Development of all departmental policies and procedures.

Responsible for management, development and implementation of corporate projects.  Worked with senior executive to research, create and implement a new managed care product for HMO Washington.  Negotiated contract for and implemented new managed behavioral health program.

Developed & maintained reimbursement, balancing and reporting procedures for start-up Medicaid Healthy Options program, including fund pool management and risk sharing analysis.  Developed system and reporting requirements for administering the Medicaid capitation system.  Finance Division Project Coordinator for corporate projects such as Interplan Tele-Processing (ITS Blue Card), Medicaid Healthy Options, Basic Health Plan, and Columbia Dental (a new capitated dental program).  Performed functions of Interplan Control Accountant, reconciled general ledger accounts and prepared equalization settlements.

Responsible for reconciliation of the $60 million National, WPS and Interplan accounts.  Met monthly BlueCross BlueShield Association reporting requirements, analyzed reports, measured company performance and coordinated internal activities to improve performance.  Worked with BCBS plans nationally to resolve account equalization discrepancies, as well as billing and system issues.
